alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:35PM CDT until May 16 at 5:07PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River Near Cuero. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, FM 766 (Hell`s Gate Bridge) closed due to water across roadway between Ed Blackwell Lane and Hell`s Gate Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 27.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM CDT Sunday was 27.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.0 feet on 05/19/1992. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (4 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Guadalupe River Cuero 24.0 27.5 Sun 1 pm CDT 27.3 20.9 13.8 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM CDT.
